case.name: Luna Park Sydney Pty Limited (ACN 102 907 184) v Bose [2006] FCA 94 (8 February 2006)

citation.tocase: Arthur v Vaupotic Investments Pty Limited [2005] FCA 433
citation.text: 20 Recent authorities support the proposition that Order 35 does not require proof by way of evidence of the claim. It requires that on the face of the statement of claim there is a claim for relief sought and that the court has jurisdiction to grant that relief: see Australian Competition and Consumer Commission v 1Cellnet LLC [2005] FCA 856 per Nicholson J at [14] and Arthur v Vaupotic Investments Pty Limited [2005] FCA 433 ; cf Wu v Avin Operations Pty Limited (ACN 076 956 913) [2006] FCA 36 at [49] , [57] [58].

citation.tocase: Australian Competition and Consumer Commission v 1Cellnet LLC [2005] FCA 856
citation.text: 20 Recent authorities support the proposition that Order 35 does not require proof by way of evidence of the claim. It requires that on the face of the statement of claim there is a claim for relief sought and that the court has jurisdiction to grant that relief: see Australian Competition and Consumer Commission v 1Cellnet LLC [2005] FCA 856 per Nicholson J at [14] and Arthur v Vaupotic Investments Pty Limited [2005] FCA 433 ; cf Wu v Avin Operations Pty Limited (ACN 076 956 913) [2006] FCA 36 at [49] , [57] [58].

citation.tocase: Australian Securities Commission v McLeod (1994) 54 FCR 309
citation.text: 17 It was not open to the court to make an order for default judgment except on the bringing of a motion supported by evidence as to the merits of the application: see Australian Securities Commission v McLeod (1994) 54 FCR 309 per Drummond J; see also for example Grey v Mango Prepaid Calling Cards Pty Limited [2004] FCA 1664 per Nicholson J, and Zomba Production Music v. Roadhouse Productions (2001) 190 ALR 288 per Stone J.

citation.tocase: Commissioner of Taxation v Finn [1960] HCA 69 ; (1960) 103 CLR 165
citation.text: 16 It was until recently well settled that there was no presumption upon default of the respondent of the correctness of the applicant's claims: see Commissioner of Taxation v Finn [1960] HCA 69 ; (1960) 103 CLR 165.

citation.tocase: Grey v Mango Prepaid Calling Cards Pty Limited [2004] FCA 1664
citation.text: 17 It was not open to the court to make an order for default judgment except on the bringing of a motion supported by evidence as to the merits of the application: see Australian Securities Commission v McLeod (1994) 54 FCR 309 per Drummond J; see also for example Grey v Mango Prepaid Calling Cards Pty Limited [2004] FCA 1664 per Nicholson J, and Zomba Production Music v. Roadhouse Productions (2001) 190 ALR 288 per Stone J.

citation.tocase: Wu v Avin Operations Pty Limited (ACN 076 956 913) [2006] FCA 36
citation.text: 20 Recent authorities support the proposition that Order 35 does not require proof by way of evidence of the claim. It requires that on the face of the statement of claim there is a claim for relief sought and that the court has jurisdiction to grant that relief: see Australian Competition and Consumer Commission v 1Cellnet LLC [2005] FCA 856 per Nicholson J at [14] and Arthur v Vaupotic Investments Pty Limited [2005] FCA 433 ; cf Wu v Avin Operations Pty Limited (ACN 076 956 913) [2006] FCA 36 at [49] , [57] [58].

citation.text: 17 It was not open to the court to make an order for default judgment except on the bringing of a motion supported by evidence as to the merits of the application: see Australian Securities Commission v McLeod (1994) 54 FCR 309 per Drummond J; see also for example Grey v Mango Prepaid Calling Cards Pty Limited [2004] FCA 1664 per Nicholson J, and Zomba Production Music v. Roadhouse Productions (2001) 190 ALR 288 per Stone J.
